metadata.title: CVE-2019-8354 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in SoX 14.4.2. lsx_make_lpf in effect_i_dsp.c hasan integer overflow on the result of multiplication fed into malloc. Whenthe buffer is allocated, it is smaller than expected, leading to aheap-based buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8354` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm1').
